result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew C. Blanchard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfere w/ Child Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:28 a.m. Defendant Matthew C. Blanchard in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Matthew C. Blanchard in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI received by all parties. Victim Impact Statement filed. Schiek statement on sentencing. Burns statement to corrections to last page of psychological reports referring to numerous fights - Burns states never had physical fights or assaults. Page 4 of PSI - allegedly in contact with KV - denies; facts are not correct - denies sending letters to victims using other people's names. On page 11 of PSI - discussion with brother Troy on phone - denies statement in PSI.  Burns files letter from VA. Burns statement that Defendant has arranged payment to ONSO of $1310 for reimbursement of extradition costs from his inheritance. Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Prison - 3 years
Initial Confinement - 18 months
Extended Supervision 18 -months
Retitution of $1310 
Jail credit - 149 days 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No contact with KPV
No intoxicants; no taverns; no controlled substances
AODA assessment and follow-through
Must comply with any treatment or counseling as recommended by AODA assessment
No contact with minors other than his own children without prior approval from PO.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Is not eligible for challenge incarcertation program or substance abuse program
Appeal rights given. NADVI given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 11:25 a.m.

10:22 a.m. Defendant Matthew C. Blanchard, in custody, in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement on agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Court orders PSI report be completed. Court revokes bond pending sentencing. Adj. 10:31 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter. Original retained in illegible original file

4:15 p.m. Defendant Matthew C. Blanchard in court, in custody, with attorney Mary L.R. Burns. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Burns statement--defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds defendant over for trial. Information filed; defendant in receipt; waives reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Burns speaks to bond--has outstanding warrants in other counties; requests signature bond in order for defendant to be transported to address other warrants. Michlig objects. Court denies bond modification. Current bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 10:15 am.

1:28 p.m. Defendant Matthew C. Blanchard in court via video with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Matthew C. Blanchard in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, not reviewed with defendant - -set for preliminary hearing 
Bail continued.
Adj. 1:30 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
No contact with juvenile female identified in complaint, KPV, dob 1/17/99

1:31 p.m. Defendant Matthew C. Blanchard in court, in custody, via video.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond. Adj. 1:37p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
per Judy @ ONSO - now at ONSO
Per Mary at ONSO being held in Forest County Mississippi
